intro: Icaria fictilis, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Icaria fictilis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
